questions.question_text:
You need to meet the technical requirement for large-volume document retrieval.
What should you create?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Activity policies allow custom alerts to be sent or actions taken when user activity is detected. For example, you want to know every time:

A user tries to sign in and fails 70 times in one minute
A user downloads 7,000 files
A user is logged in from an unfamiliar country/region

Selected Answer: A
Correct answer given.

choices.B: a data loss prevention (DLP) policy from the Microsoft 365 compliance center
choices.C: a file policy from Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps
choices.D: an alert policy from the Microsoft 365 compliance center
choices.A: an activity policy from Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps

questions.question_text:
You need to create the Safe Attachments policy to meet the technical requirements.
Which option should you select?

discussion.content:
Dynamic Delivery 
Delivers messages immediately, but replaces attachments with placeholders until Safe Attachments scanning is complete.
Messages that contain malicious attachments are quarantined. 
By default, only admins (not users) can review, release, or delete the messages.
Avoid message delays while protecting recipients from malicious files.

Selected Answer: D
Came on exam 09-05-2022

Given answer is correct. Get more understanding from the source.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/safe-attachments-about?view=o365-worldwide#safe-attachments-policy-settings
in exam 28/6/2023
Came on exam 22-12-2022
On exam today 23 Oct 2022. I answered the same, D. I passed.
still valid, it was in my exam last Feb 5, 2022

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You plan to implement the endpoint protection device configuration profiles to support the planned changes.
You need to identify which devices will be supported, and how many profiles you should implement.
What should you identify? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: So 1 and 3 for the first and 2 for the second ?

comments.content: Checked on current Endpoint Device configuration profiles
What I was thinking as well. endpoint only supports windows 10 & mac OS and requires a policy for each.

discussion.content:
Tested today - Endpoint protection supports MacOS and Windows 10. A profile will need to be set up for both.

So the answer is Device 1 and 3, and 2 profiles.
Devices 1 and 3 only. 2 profiles https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/endpoint-protection-configure
in exam 28/6/2023
This answers are wrong: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/endpoint-protection-configure
On exam today 23 Oct 2022. I answered devices 1 and 3, and 2 profiles. I passed.
Was in Exam today 20 Aug 2022
Endpoint protection configuration profiles https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/endpoint-protection-configure
Came on exam 09-05-2022

Endpoint Protection Supports macOS and Windows 10
Device 1
Device 3

Numbers of Policy: 2

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/endpoint-protection-configure#create-a-device-profile-containing-endpoint-protection-settings
still valid, it was in my exam last Feb 5, 2022

Device1 and Device 3 only.
2 profiles.

Agree with pred015 and tested this within our tenant. Only Windows 10 and later & macOS have the option to create a configuration profile that uses the Endpoint Protection template.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/endpoint-protection-configure

comments.content: TheWallPTA is correct in that you can setup a configuration profile for all the platforms....but everyone else here is correct that as of 1/28/2022 only Windows 10 and later and macOS have the "Endpoint Protection" template.
DONT BOTHER. admin wants us to fail
Admin, delete this comment please. MacOS and Win10 and 2 is actually correct

discussion.content:
I think the answer is correct. According to the reference link, this platform can be selected:
Android device administrator
Android Enterprise
iOS/iPadOS
macOS
Windows 10 and later
Windows 8.1 and later

I think that you have reason. Only WIndows 10 later and MacOS can be compatilibity with Endpoint Security profiles. When you create a profile, yon must to select the type of device:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/endpoint-protection-configure
"Platform: Choose the platform of your devices. Your options:

macOS
Windows 10 and later"
Endpoint protection device configuration profiles are supported only on WIndows 10 and later, and macOS

questions.question_text:
You need to create the DLP policy to meet the technical requirements.
What should you configure first?

comments.content: This is correct because they have their own sensitive information type, it is not a standard one that comes built in (PII, US SSN, credit cards etc.), so you have to create it in order to then use it in a policy

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Going for answer A here.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/create-a-custom-sensitive-information-type?view=o365-worldwide

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
